meta.description: WooCommerce allows users to transform their WordPress website into functional online store

options.label: Coupon
options.description: Coupons are a great way to offer discounts and rewards to your customers, and can help promote sales across your shop.

options.label: Customer
options.description: Customers are the people who buy products from your store.

options.label: Orders
options.description: Orders are the completed purchases in your store.

options.label: Orders Action
options.description: Sends a confirmation email for the order to the customer.

options.label: Order Notes
options.description: Order notes are comments that customers can add to their orders during the checkout process.

options.label: Products
options.description: Products are the goods you sell in your store.

options.label: Product Variations
options.description: Product Variants are the different versions of a product that you sell.

options.label: Product Attributes
options.description: Product Attributes are the characteristics of a product that you sell.

options.label: Product Attribute Terms
options.description: Product Attribute Terms are the values of a product attribute.

options.label: Product Categories
options.description: Product Categories are the groups of products that you sell.

options.label: Product Shipping Classes
options.description: Shipping Classes are the groups of products that you sell.

options.label: Product Tags
options.description: Product Tags are the labels that you can assign to your products.

options.label: Product Reviews
options.description: Product Reviews are the comments that customers can leave on your products.

options.label: Tax Classes
options.description: Tax Classes are the groups of products that you sell.

options.label: Tax Rates
options.description: Tax Rates are the rates that you charge for taxes on your products.

options.label: Reports
options.description: Reports are the summaries of your store's performance.

options.label: Refunds
options.description: Custom API allows you to perform operations that are not covered by the default resources.

options.label: Custom
options.description: Custom API allows you to perform operations that are not covered by the default resources.

meta.description: Select the resource you want to work with.
